Comment: As much as I hope you are right, the senate is so horribly disadvantageous for Democrats that even if Trump is at 20% favorability, it would be far from certain.  We have three Democratic senators in plausible Republican pickups that are retiring (Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire).  Then we also have to defend Georgia.  And if we do all of that, due to Vance we still need to pickup four seats for the smallest possible majority.  Which means winning Maine \*and\* North Carolina, \*plus\* two of Florida, Ohio, Iowa, Texas, or Alaska.  I'm not saying it's impossible; I'm saying it's going to take more than an unpopular president. We need a strongly-Democratic national environment, plus recruiting seven great candidates, plus actually having remotely-fair elections at all.
Author: MadContrabassoonist

Comment: I love the spirit, but the certainty is unwarranted.  The Senate is a dated, undemocratic institution that rewards land over people, and with the current urban-rural divide is going to be a slog for Democrats even in the absolute best of years.  We have 8 races we have to win (most in states Harris didn't win), 7 of which we won't have an incumbent.  That's 7 opportunities for a fumble with some nationally-untested candidate, plus multiple opportunities for Republican state governments to fuck with the election.      We can do it but we need clear-eyed resolve, not blind, unearned optimism.
Author: MadContrabassoonist
